intro: Bupleurum ranunculoides var. provinciale, commonly known as the Alpine Buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic compounds. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine meadows, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are pinnately compound, and its flowers are yellow with five petals. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
